questions.question: What does the noise_latent_perlinpinpin node allow for in ComfyUI?
questions.answer: The noise_latent_perlinpinpin node allows creating latent spaces filled with perlin-based noise that can be used by the samplers.
questions.subject: noise_latent_perlinpinpin

questions.question: What is the limitation when upscaling with the noise_latent_perlinpinpin node?
questions.answer: You should keep the exact same aspect ratios if you want to upscale or the patterns will not match.
questions.subject: noise_latent_perlinpinpin

questions.question: How has the noise_latent_perlinpinpin algorithm been simplified?
questions.answer: The algorithm has been simplified to support all resolutions and make it easier to use, with no artifacts.
questions.subject: noise_latent_perlinpinpin

questions.question: What is the purpose of the magic line of code in the noise_latent_perlinpinpin description?
questions.answer: The magic line of code, 'noise = torch.remainder(torch.abs(noise)*1000000,11)/11', destroys the smooth pattern while keeping it predictable at all scales.
questions.subject: noise_latent_perlinpinpin

questions.question: What do I need to have installed to use the noise_latent_perlinpinpin node?
questions.answer: You need to have BlenderNeko noise related nodes and the workflow, which can be found at https://github.com/BlenderNeko/ComfyUI_Noise, to use the noise_latent_perlinpinpin node.
questions.subject: noise_latent_perlinpinpin

questions.question: What is recommended for better upscales when using this node?
questions.answer: Using the city96 latent upscaler, available at https://github.com/city96/SD-Latent-Upscaler, for upscaling is highly recommended.
questions.subject: noise_latent_perlinpinpin

questions.question: What does the workflow included in this image represent?
questions.answer: The workflow included in the image represents the basics of using perlin-based noise with ComfyUI, including noisy perlin injection, SDXL Base, VAE decode, lanczos resize, VAE encode, and SDXL refiner.
